His relationship with David Letterman remains unaffected- his Late Night predecessor apparently called him over the holidays.`` It was just a quick call,'' Conan O'Brien qualifies. We hadn't spoken for a long time, and David Letterman just called to basically say, you know,' I haven't checked in on you. I just wanted to make sure that we were good.' And I said,` We've always been good.' I have a lot of respect for that guy. It was not a lengthy phone call. He's not a blabbermouth, but it was nice. It was just nice to get the call. MSPmentor says Eric Schmidt 's Google has gained`` more channel partner momentum with managed services providers. Indeed, 29 of the world's top 100 MSPs now promote Google Apps to their end-customers.'' The article asks, Will that trend continue when the CEO crown soon shifts from Eric Schmidt to Google co-founder Larry Page? While there's no reason to think Google would kill off Google Apps, there are scenarios that could trouble enterprise customers, Gartner analysts say. else say that, so I don't give it a lot of credence.'' I wonder aloud whether,`` as a leader you have to be a bit intimidating?'' But Donald Rumsfeld demurs- Oh no, in fact you don't want to be. The truth is that I had tough jobs, a lot of them, and I'm comfortable taking tough decisions and I ask tough questions... and that isn't fun sometimes for people... But I've always been open to people coming back. Donald Rumsfeld 's book has certainly generated a lot of tough comeback from those who see it as an extended exercise in self-justification and score-settling. President Bush Dick Cheney of State Colin Powell says he is voting for Barack Obama .`` He has both style and substance. I think he is a transformational figure,'' Colin Powell said on NBC's`` Meet the Press.'' Barack Obama displayed a steadiness. Showed intellectual vigor. He has a definitive way of doing business that will do us well, Colin Powell said. Colin Powell , a retired US general and a Republican, was once seen as a possible presidential candidate himself.
